DataElement.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation COVID-19 Virus Pandemic Impacted Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the hematopoietic cell transplantation was impacted by the SARS coronavirus 2 pandemic.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation SARS Coronavirus 2 Pandemic Impact
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species._A positive-sense single-stranded RNA virus in the genus Betacoronavirus. It is the causative agent of the 2019-2020 severe acute respiratory syndrome outbreak._An epidemic occurring worldwide, or over a very wide area, crossing international boundaries, and usually affecting a large number of people. (A dictionary of epidemiology, edited for the International Epidemiological Association by John M. Last, Oxford University Press 2001)_The effect or consequence of an event or condition.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):The grafting of tissues from one individual to another or place to place within a single individual.

Concepts.definition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.

Property.preferredDefinition: A positive-sense single-stranded RNA virus in the genus Betacoronavirus. It is the causative agent of the 2019-2020 severe acute respiratory syndrome outbreak.:An epidemic occurring worldwide, or over a very wide area, crossing international boundaries, and usually affecting a large number of people. (A dictionary of epidemiology, edited for the International Epidemiological Association by John M. Last, Oxford University Press 2001):The effect or consequence of an event or condition.

Concepts.definition: A positive-sense single-stranded RNA virus in the genus Betacoronavirus. It is the causative agent of the 2019-2020 severe acute respiratory syndrome outbreak.

An epidemic occurring worldwide, or over a very wide area, crossing international boundaries, and usually affecting a large number of people. (A dictionary of epidemiology, edited for the International Epidemiological Association by John M. Last, Oxford University Press 2001)
The effect or consequence of an event or condition.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
